title: Simulation/VR-Based Foundational Legal Education Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic legal terminology and fundamental concepts of contract law
context.additional_context: Law education course based on lecture capture in VR simulations using personal devices. Continuously monitors learning effectiveness through formative assessments, focusing on improving practical skills via legal case analysis

learning_goals: Students can analyze case-by-case scenarios of contract law’s core principles (obligation, performance, breach) in a VR simulation environment.
Learners can accurately define and apply over 90% of legal terminology using recorded lecture materials.

Participants accurately judge ≥4 of five key decision points in three VR-based mock contract scenarios, producing reports that meet ≥3 of five rubric items reflecting real-world contracts (supply, collaboration, NDA).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
